Text: the files arent in mp3 or mp4 format...unfortunately, those are the only ones that i understand...when i tried to play them they went to microsoft video player....and wouldnt play.

First of all - there is not such thing as "microsoft video player", I guess you mean WMP, wich don't support natively Vorbis format.

Second - Vorbis is very common and well-known lossy audio format and it's my first choice for daily audio media. The quality is acceptable.

There are many free media players with Vorbis support out there, e.g. Foobar2000, Winamp, Aimp, etc.
